entry.title: Stop AppHomePageHandlerTest pinning to the taskbar
entry.content:
AppHomePageHandlerTest.Create* tests are pinning shortcuts to the

Windows taskbar, and leaking shortcuts on the Desktop. This CL fixes

that by using OsIntegrationTestOverrideImpl::BlockingRegistration and

SimulateDeleteShortcutsByUser.



It also adds a call to FlushShortcutTasks() after the dialog is

closed, because that creates shortcuts. This is needed because

SimulateDeleteShortcutsByUser dchecks if the expected shortcuts don't

exist.



This is a reland of crrev.com/c/4629880, but with a fix for the failure

on my new bestie browser_tests_no_field_trial. If

AreSubManagersExecute is not enabled, we can't/don't need to call

SimulateDeleteShortcutsByUser because uninstalling the WebApp will

have deleted the shortcuts already.



Bug: 1454110, 1457419

Change-Id: I983ba40ac1ea3eb0ff4a6027331d49e10f1356ad

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647535

Reviewed-by: Daniel Murphy

entry.title: Android: Add ResettersForTesting.register() to //chrome/android/features/tab_ui
entry.content:
And to some files in //chrome that were deps of tab_ui tests.



I used Android Studio's "Structured Replace" to add it to all

setForTesting methods that contained a single assignment. Then

went through all spots to reset to "null/false" vs |oldValue|.



I removed calls to modified set*ForTesting(null/false) methods using

grep/sed/python then removed empty @After methods. I then manually

reviewed all changes and made fixups where necessary.



* Cleans up some calls that had both @VisibleForTesting and

ForTest suffix (annotation is incorrect in this case).

* Renamed a few test-only symbols to have "ForTesting" suffix.

* Removed UI thread restriction for

SyncServiceFactory.setInstanceForTesting()



Bug: 1416224

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Remove RemovePositionedObjects within MoveChildrenTo
entry.content:
This was originally added in.

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/198fcf0c8e9ffb1f30b27b644541ccd960c75084



I'm unable to view the original bug - but presumably this was due to

a DCHECK that an OOF wasn't getting laid out after being left within

an anonymous table part.



This doesn't seem needed now as anonymous blocks can't be containing

blocks (they could previously), and table-parts now can be containing

blocks (they couldn't previously).

entry.title: Introduce HistorySyncSessionDurationsMetricsRecorder
entry.content:
This class records the active session durations during which history

sync is vs isn't enabled.



It's bundled into the existing SyncSessionDurationsMetricsRecorder

(i.e. the existing class owns and managed the new one).

It's a separate class so as to not make

SyncSessionDurationsMetricsRecorder even more complicated than it

already is.

The new class duplicates a little bit of logic from the existing one,

e.g. for excluding inactive session time. This seems small enough to

not be worth extracting.

entry.content:
This is a preparation for renderer state aware resource scheduler in

the network service. We plan to add additional information to

ClientId. Current public interfaces, like Increment(), to create new

ClientId don't work well when we add more information to ClientId

because additional information may have no notion of "increment."



This CL modifies the public interface to create ClientIds so that it

can be flexible to have more information.

entry.title: [Image Capture] Support advanced constraints beyond the first set
entry.content:
A constraint falls into one of three groups. The groups are:

1) Required constraints are all non-advanced constraints that are

required:

videoTrack.applyConstraints({exposureTime: {exact: 50}})

videoTrack.applyConstraints({exposureTime: {min: 40, max: 60}})

Support for these was added by https://crrev.com/c/4328771.

2) Optional basic constraints are the remaining non-advanced

constraints:

videoTrack.applyConstraints({exposureTime: 50})

videoTrack.applyConstraints({exposureTime: {ideal: 50}})

Support for these was added by https://crrev.com/c/4328771.

3) Advanced constraints are all constraints specified using

the advanced keyword:

a) In the first advanced constraint set, the implementation

supports only bare value constraints other than DOMString lists:

videoTrack.applyConstraints({advanced: [{exposureTime: 50}]})

This CL does not change the status of these constraints.

b) Previously the implementation did not support advanced

constraint sets beyond the first constraint set but completely

ignored them but this CL enables the support:

videoTrack.applyConstraints({

advanced: [{}, {exposureTime: 50}]

})

videoTrack.applyConstraints({

advanced: [{}, {exposureTime: {exact: 50}}]

})

videoTrack.applyConstraints({

advanced: [{}, {exposureTime: {min: 40, max: 60}}]

})



Bug: 1408091

Change-Id: I1579eedcde3fe723c2720d550b49930015c509f9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647370

entry.title: Send legacy tech report from blink
entry.content:
Deprecation::CountDeprecation will send the report to a new end point

that is located at frame.mojom API. It will then later upload to

enterprise management service through the browser process.



The event will only be sent when the feature is enabled by an enterprise

policy so that we avoid unnecessary IPC for normal users. A command line

flag is used to pass the flag to the renderer process.

entry.title: [DBSC] Add preemptive cookie rotation for DBSC

If the cookie is missing/expired, requests are blocked until a refresh

operation is completed. This would cause a significant delay in loading

network requests, therefore we do preemptive cookie rotation.

entry.title: Prerender: Grant a grace period to BFCache retriggering tests
entry.content:
Before this CL, tests of retriggering prerender on BFCache restoration

used `HasHostForUrl` to confirm that retriggering did not occur when

it was false (see review comments I attached). However, `HasHostForUrl`

returns false regardless of whether `UpdateSpeculationRules` has been

retriggered if it is called immediately after restoration.



This CL inserts `RunLoop().RunUntilIdle()` right after the BFCache

restoration to allow a time to determine whether retriggering actually

occurs by `HasHostForUrl`.

entry.title: Stop explicitly syncing SAA grants after renewals
entry.content:
We don't need to explicitly sync the grants because they're already

implicitly synced by an observer (ProfileNetworkContextService), and not

syncing them will not cause any race condition (in contrast to

StorageAccessPermissionGrantContext, where an explicit sync is

necessary).



(There's no browsertest coverage/changes for this, since it's tricky

to mock time in a browsertest.)

entry.title: Introduce SharedDictionaryAccessObserver Mojo IPC
entry.content:
This CL introduces SharedDictionaryAccessObserver Mojo IPC which is used

to notify the usage of shared dictionary from the network service to the

browser process. When a shared dictionary is used

WebContentsObserver::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed() will be asynchronously

invoked.



We will use this to show the origin in the "Cookies and site data"

dialog (crbug.com/1413922#c59) when a shared dictionary is used in

succeeding CLs



For navigation request:

- content::NavigationRequest in the browser process implements the

observer interface.

- NavigationRequest::OnStartChecksComplete() passes the mojo remote

interface of the observer through NavigationURLLoader::Create(),

NavigationURLLoaderImpl() and CreateResourceRequest() into

network::ResourceRequest's TrustedParams' shared_dictionary_observer

field.

- In the network process, URLLoaderFactory gets the mojo remote

interface of the observer from `resource_request`, and passes it to

SharedDictionaryAccessChecker.

- The SharedDictionaryAccessChecker is passed to URLLoader. URLLoader

calls IsAllowedToRead() when dictionary is used. And the checker

sends the OnSharedDictionaryAccessed() IPC.

- When content::NavigationRequest receives the IPC, it calls:

NavigatorDelegate::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsImpl::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsObserver::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()



For subresource request:

- content::RenderFrameHostImpl in the browser process implements the

observer interface.

- URLLoaderFactoryParamsHelper::CreateForFrame() is called when

committing a page navigation. The method sets the mojo remote

interface of the observer to URLLoaderFactoryParams's

shared_dictionary_observer field.

- In the network process, CorsURLLoaderFactory receives and keeps the

remote interface.

- For dictionary read case: URLLoaderFactory passes the pointer of the

remote interface to SharedDictionaryAccessChecker. And The

SharedDictionaryAccessChecker is passed to URLLoader. URLLoader

calls IsAllowedToRead() when dictionary is used. And the checker

sends the OnSharedDictionaryAccessed() IPC.

- For dictionary write case: When CorsURLLoader receives a response,

it passes the pointer of the remote interface to

SharedDictionaryAccessChecker. And the checker's IsAllowedToWrite()

is called by SharedDictionaryStorage when there is a valid

use-as-dictionary header.

- When content::RenderFrameHostImpl receives the IPC, it calls:

RenderFrameHostDelegate::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsImpl::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsObserver::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()



For shared worker and service worker case:

- StoragePartitionImpl::ServiceWorkerSharedDictionaryAccessObserver

in the browser process implements the observer interface.

- URLLoaderFactoryParamsHelper::CreateForWorker() sets the mojo remote

interface of the observer to URLLoaderFactoryParams's

shared_dictionary_observer field.

- When ServiceWorkerSharedDictionaryAccessObserver receives the IPC,

it calls:

RenderFrameHostImpl::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

RenderFrameHostDelegate::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsImpl::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()

-> WebContentsObserver::OnSharedDictionaryAccessed()



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I71827fe43912de2d7c2271123717260772122cbf

entry.content:
Usually we will call WillBeginMainFrame() before

DidBeginMainFrame(), which would create current_frame_timing_info_.



However, there could be racy conditions where the

AnimationFrameTimingMonitor itself is only created in the middle of

the frame, so current_frame_timing_info_ would still be null.



I couldn't reproduce this in a test, so this fix is defensive.

entry.title: Revert "[Contextual Search] Revive 4 tests in ContextualSearchCriticalTest."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3795a19238e7597ee8d76ee7cb00a35840050d3a.



Reason for revert: ContextualSearchCriticalTest#testChainedSearchLoadsCorrectSearchTerm is still flaky and creates a consistent failure on adroid-arm-tests bot.

failed build links:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/android-arm-tests/18627/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/android-arm-tests/18628/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> [Contextual Search] Revive 4 tests in ContextualSearchCriticalTest.

>

> The 4 disabled tests in ContextualSearchCriticalTest

> testChainedSearchCreatesNewContent

> testChainedSearchLoadsCorrectSearchTerm

> testChainedSearchContentVisibility

> testChainedTapsRemovedFromHistory

>

> are the tests that make multiple calls to simulate{Non}ResolveSearch(),

> i.e., try to open the panel when it is already open (peeked). For these

> tests, 2 causes for failures were found:

> 1. "Space problem": TapFarFromPreviousSuppression suppresses clicks

> that > 75 dp (see RETAP_DISTANCE_SQUARED_DP) away from the previous

> click. For the test case with "Search Term Resolution", increase

> screen resolutions have made "Search" and "Resolution" so distant

> that successive clicking would cause the suppression to kick in. It

> seems this issue was mitigated by retryPanelBarInteractions(), which

> repeats clicks -- but that only masks the problem. Combined with (2)

> below, this issue manifests as error message:

>

> Caused by: org.chromium.base.test.util.CriteriaNotSatisfiedException:

> Expected: is "Resolution"

> but: was null

>

> This issue affects:

> testChainedSearchLoadsCorrectSearchTerm_

> testChainedSearchContentVisibility

>

> 2. "Time problem": ContextualSearchInstrumentationBase.clickWordNode()

> simulates click and waits for the panel to peek. However, when the

> panel is already peeked from an earlier click, the wait exits

> quickly. This breaks the callers trigger{Non}Resolve(), which rely

> on the wait to temporarily tweak "decided" to a provided value. In

> particular, the non-resolved flow (tweak to false) on "Resolution"

> would behave as the resolved flow, and lead to assertion errors,

> e.g., mFakeServer.getLoadedUrlCount() returning the wrong value.

>

> This CL fixing (2) and revives the 4 tests. The fix changes

> trigger{Non}Resolve() to wait for a "fresh" panel peek by ignoring an

> existing peeked panel. Ultimately this detects a fresh call to

> OverlayPanel.peekPanel(). Ideally we'd use an observer, but since the

> testing framework uses polling and delays, so a simple time-based

> solution is used:

> * Have OverlayPanel store |mLastPeekInstant|, updated on each

> peekPanel() call, and accessed via getLastPeekInstant().

> * In ContextualSearchInstrumentationBase, add

> waitForPanelToFreshlyPeek(), which is like waitForPanelToPeek() but

> also waits for getLastPeekInstant() to change.

> * Change clickWordNode() to use waitForPanelToFreshlyPeek().

>

> Note that (1) is now benign, with retryPanelBarInteractions() creating

> repeated click to close panel and reopen to elide the suppression

> problem. We'll address it in a follow-up.

>

> Bug: 1192285

> Change-Id: I8de3c71664c4c5ba1b79b43537e370a9d9215a1a

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4637353

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Gang Wu

> Reviewed-by: Donn Denman

> Commit-Queue: Samuel Huang

entry.title: WebNN: Validate constant operand's ArrayBufferView for graph building
entry.content:
This CL enhances `MLGraph::ValidateAndInitializeResourcesInfo()` that

also validates that the ArrayBufferView of a constant operand is not

detached if the constant is used during a graph building process. This

would ensure a backend, such as MLGraphXnnpack, could access the content

of the ArrayBufferView of this constant operand in `BuildAsyncImpl()` or

`BuildSyncImpl()` implementation.



This CL also adds a test case into FakeMLGraphTest.BuildTest that

verifies the detached ArrayBufferView could be detected and the error

message could be thrown accordingly.

entry.title: Revert "[Browsing Data Model][site data] Report storage accesses to BDM"
entry.content:
This reverts commit f265b00f0f0f74da0e4c727f10526da619f19879.



Reason for revert: Breaking linux-chromeos-chrome consistently due to ThirdPartyDomStorageAccessMetricsObserverBrowserTest* tests failures. See crbug.com/1458721 for details.



Original change's description:

> [Browsing Data Model][site data] Report storage accesses to BDM

>

> In this CL:

> - Introduced `SessionStorage` type to BDM for access reports.

> - Moved storage handling under the new feature `kMigrateStorageToBDM`.

> - Updated storage access report to use `blink::StorageKey` instead of

> `GURL` to maintain 3p context and support storage partitioning.

> - Exposed storage_key() method to the RenderFrameHost public interface.

> - Reported access for storage types (i.e. local storage, session storage

> and quota managed storage) to BDM in site data.

> - Added browser tests for all new access reports in BDM.

> - WebSQL is covered in access reports and its browser test relating to

> Quota Managed data.

> - Added a test suite in PSCS unit tests for BDM

> `OnBrowsingDataAccessed` to cover storage access reports.

>

entry.title: [fix-swo-violations] Fix sort comparison function
entry.content:
Make sure CompareAlphaDirsFirst comparison function is a strict weak

ordering by fixing compare(a, a) to return false.

Using a comparator which is not a strict weak ordering is undefined

behavior and crashes with _LIBCPP_DEBUG_STRICT_WEAK_ORDERING_CHECK

enabled.

entry.title: Revert "Linux sandbox: allow alarm() if using in-proc stack dumping"
entry.content:
This reverts commit eb0253311ecf2432d3f6bff3f0a4cefe505cd6b3.



Reason for revert: BaselinePolicy.InProcessStackDumpsDontCrashOnSandbox test fails on different bots



Original change's description:

> Linux sandbox: allow alarm() if using in-proc stack dumping

>

> StackDumpSignalHandler() has an alarm() call (in case the default

> signal handler does not crash the process, the alarm handler crashes

> the process in a couple seconds). This alarm() call is a

> sandbox violation and therefore crashes the process with a SIGSEGV.

> Sometimes this makes tests pass and other times it makes tests fail.

> Fix it by allowing alarm() in the sandbox if in-proc stack dumping

> is enabled.

>

> Bug: 1396451

> Change-Id: I4d05ddb8547ae39772c81a106d0d73ec63c87db7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4597875

> Reviewed-by: Lei Zhang

> Commit-Queue: Matthew Denton

> Reviewed-by: Tom Sepez

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1163117}



Bug: 1396451, 1458715

Change-Id: I230dc1e3283d0ad9ba56aa1b9b991898b690cd30

No-Tree-Checks: true

entry.title: Fix a DCHECK in PasswordGenerationAgent::GeneratedPasswordAccepted.
entry.content:
`current_generation_item_ == NULL` is reproducible in the wild. I don't

have a reproduction case but it's possible that the generation UI

survives a navigation. On desktop:

- presave a password with empty username,

- on sign up generate a password (don't type a username),

- Chrome pops up "Do you want to update" bubble.



That bubble will survive the navigations. If PasswordFormManager

actually survives too (e.g. it was for a submitted form) then the

renderer may get a signal to accept the password when it's too late.

entry.title: Remove page sizing hacks for print web tests, and fix tests.
entry.content:
To retain the current behavior in print web tests in crrev.com/c/4567866

we kept the magical scaling of 1.3333... there. Although

PrintFrameToBitmap() suggested that it wanted things in CSS pixels (the

parameter is named page_size_in_pixels), we were actually expecting it

to be in points, since Blink would perform that conversion (prior to the

aforementioned CL). So we added a temporary points-to-CSS-pixels

conversion borkery right there in that function.



This CL removes all such temporary conversion hacks, and contains all

the necessary test rebaselines and rewrites.



For WPT print reftests in particular, though, the situation was a bit

different. We were already passing the page size (4 by 2 inches) in

points to PrintFrameToBitmap() (even though the parameter is named

page_size_in_pixels). So now we have to actually pass it in pixels. :)

Multiply the inches by 96 instead of 72, and explain why we use 4 by 2,

and not 5 by 3, for the time being.



A few reftest expectations had to be changed, because the page size has

changed. E.g. for web_tests/printing/multicol-2-pages.html, only 4 lines

(instead of 5) will fit on the first page now.



This also fixes two existing reftests, most likely because of rounding

errors no longer being there.



Only web test behavior changes are intended with this CL.



In detail:



- Legacy web test (web_tests/printing/): The page size is 1.333 times

smaller than before (normally 800 by 600 CSS pixels, instead of 800 by

600 points).



- WPT print tests: No changes.



Bug: 1450167

Change-Id: I9db5a21f4456730575f2e97b127390299c8fb2c6

entry.title: Fix OoB read in neon implementation of ProcessARateVectorKernel
entry.content:
The test case and reproduction steps are attached to the bug report.

The short version is: a relatively simple JS only test case makes it

possible to hit the following DCHECK on Linux/armv7. In non DCHECK

builds this results in OoB access to two arrays.



[3664:3676:0627/114720.581346:8348136604:FATAL:oscillator_kernel_neon.cc(219)] Check failed: read0[m] < periodic_wave_size (4096 vs. 4096)

0 0x000003f90886 base::debug::CollectStackTrace()

1 0x000003f81c14 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()

2 0x000003ed81b2 logging::LogMessage::~LogMessage()

3 0x000003ec4db6 logging::(anonymous namespace)::DCheckLogMessage::~DCheckLogMessage()

4 0x000003ec4c98 logging::CheckError::~CheckError()

5 0x00000611b36e blink::OscillatorHandler::ProcessARateVectorKernel()

6 0x00000610c7de blink::OscillatorHandler::ProcessARateVector()

7 0x00000610c95e blink::OscillatorHandler::ProcessARate()

8 0x00000610cbec blink::OscillatorHandler::Process()

9 0x0000060dcc30 blink::AudioHandler::ProcessIfNecessary()

10 0x0000060e1e4e blink::AudioNodeOutput::Pull()

11 0x0000060e18a8 blink::AudioNodeInput::SumAllConnections()

12 0x0000060e19aa blink::AudioNodeInput::Pull()

13 0x000006111a68 blink::RealtimeAudioDestinationHandler::Render()

14 0x00000611290e blink::AudioDestination::RequestRender()

15 0x0000061125fc blink::AudioDestination::Render()

16 0x00000658280c content::RendererWebAudioDeviceImpl::Render()

17 0x000006582862 content::RendererWebAudioDeviceImpl::Render()

18 0x000001d23960 media::SilentSinkSuspender::Render()

19 0x000001cfe7d0 media::AudioOutputDeviceThreadCallback::Process()

20 0x000001cf56c8 media::AudioDeviceThread::ThreadMain()

21 0x000003f74934 base::(anonymous namespace)::ThreadFunc()



I'm far from an expert when it comes to arm/neon, or webaudio, but

from what I can tell the code already expects the input values can be

outside of periodic_wave_size bound. This is why the read_index_mask

is applied to read1 array. It does not get applied to read0 for which

the DCHECK fails. I think this is the main bug here. In fact when

looking at SSE2 implementation of ProcessARateVectorKernel the

read_index_mask is applied to both read0 and read1. Doing the same for

arm neon implementation fixes the DCHECK and OoB read in release builds.



Bug: 1458355

Change-Id: I1b78321e57e97f0f2fd117ece0bb5a8ea4bed8e2

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4648650

Reviewed-by: Michael Wilson

Commit-Queue: Piotr Tworek

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1163421}

entry.title: WebNN: Enable pthreadpool for MLGraphXnnpack
entry.content:
Thanks to the pthreadpool's integration with Chromium Jobs API [1], this

CL creates a pthreadpool for XNNPACK Runtime that enables parallel

execution of XNNPACK operations with `base::ThreadPool` workers. Because

the `struct pthreadpool` is accessed by XNNPACK Runtime without a lock,

a `SequenceChecker` is used to ensure the accessing is thread-safe.



This CL experimentally allows the JavaScript code to set the number of

parallel workers via `MLContextOptions.numThreads` when creating an

`MLContext` of XNNPACK backend. The default value 0 means no parallel

execution. The user-supplied threads number would be capped by the

minimum value of the number of logical processors and `kMaxNumWorkItems`

which is set to 4 according to the initial testing result.



This CL also adds a dedicated `MLGraphXnnpackTest.ThreadPoolTest` that

tests the creation and execution of `MLGraphXnnpack` with different

number of threads.



[1]: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/pthreadpool/chromium/jobs.cc

entry.title: WebAppForceInstalls should only wait for windows closed in the placeholder-case
entry.content:
The RunOnOsLogin feature (b/279737385) depends on the external managers to complete their startup. The WebAppPolicyManager and ExternallyManagedAppManager sync the force-installed apps during startup. However, this sync is currently delayed until all windows of force-installed apps have been closed. If such a window is restored, the syncing will never complete until those windows are closed, and therefore the apps will not be auto-started. It seems that this behavior to wait for windows to be closed is only intended in the placeholder-app-case. This CL changes it accordingly.

entry.title: [Browsing Data Model][site data] Report storage accesses to BDM
entry.content:
In this CL:

- Introduced `SessionStorage` type to BDM for access reports.

- Moved storage handling under the new feature `kMigrateStorageToBDM`.

- Updated storage access report to use `blink::StorageKey` instead of

`GURL` to maintain 3p context and support storage partitioning.

- Exposed storage_key() method to the RenderFrameHost public interface.

- Reported access for storage types (i.e. local storage, session storage

and quota managed storage) to BDM in site data.

- Added browser tests for all new access reports in BDM.

- WebSQL is covered in access reports and its browser test relating to

Quota Managed data.

- Added a test suite in PSCS unit tests for BDM

`OnBrowsingDataAccessed` to cover storage access reports.

entry.title: [Files]: Fix UMAs collection for pure JS approach.
entry.content:
When using makeReadEntriesRecursivelyPromise_ we may call the resolve in

the "error" handling branch. This is due to the fact that

util.readEntriesRecursively does not distinguish between true error

condition and the case when we have enough entries. We detect that

condition by checking if there are some entries collected and the

scanning has not been cancelled. However, that branch was missing a call

to recordInterval. Which means that if we use JS code to search for

files and we find more than maxResults, we were not recording any UMAs.

This CL fixes that situation.

entry.content:
Currently only the who adds files may be notified of a successful file

addition. This CL enables the possibility to notify a generic observer.

As an example use case, we might want to notify an open Files app

instance that files have been added to the daemon and thus they should

now show the managed icon.

entry.title: Reland "PA: Make the allocator shim linked with PA lib, not libbase"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 416b19459ac8306d9b5a2bbeda976365f404af73.



Reason for revert: Fixed the build breakage on ios-catalyst so that some of partition_alloc_base features are available for use even when !use_partition_alloc && !use_allocator_shim. //base/allocator/dispatcher/dispatcher.cc for example depends on the pa_base regardless of use_partition_alloc and use_allocator_shim.



PS1 is the pure revert. You can see the fix as diff between PS1 and the latest PS.



Original change's description:

> Revert "PA: Make the allocator shim linked with PA lib, not libbase"

>

> This reverts commit e859b648ff035ea6c336ec2edf83e2e89cff10e6.

>

> Reason for revert: Broke Libfuzzer at https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Libfuzzer%20Upload%20iOS%20Catalyst%20Debug/43955/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > PA: Make the allocator shim linked with PA lib, not libbase

> >

> > Makes allocator_shim.o, etc. linked with libpartition_alloc

> > instead of libbase, except for unittests. Unittests remain

> > in //base just same as other unittests of PartitionAlloc

> > because of the same reason: Unittests still depend on //base,

> > gtest, etc. and it's hard to move into PA library.

> >

> > Bug: 1337681

> > Change-Id: I9f488434ad298704f9cf2a6c21f288f635403eba

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4619434

> > Commit-Queue: Yuki Shiino

> > Reviewed-by: Takashi Sakamoto

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1162261}

>

entry.title: Revert "Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d38fe2383a12431dc573c5a9948ea12156bb332c.



Reason for revert: Suspecting of breaking MetricsServiceBrowserTest.CheckCrashRenderers

in Linux CFI.



First failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20CFI/25500/test-results



Original change's description:

> Add allocator crash keys when reading PMA files

>

> This also adds a "clean exit" bit in the PMA files. So it's easier to

> tell if a PMA file being read comes from a crashed session. This is not perfect since it's still possible for the device or browser to

> crash after this bit is set. In any case, in practice this should be

> fine? (Only used to help investigate crash dumps).

>

> Also updates the "kGlobalVersion" so that we know how old a PMA file

> is in the crash reports (i.e., whether the file comes from a version

> before or after the introduction of this "clean exit" bit).

>

> In persistent_memory_allocator.cc, there was also a check that if

> a PersistentMemoryAllocator is instantiated with memory that already

> exists, and the "version" doesn't match, then it is set to corrupt.

> I modified this CHECK because that's not quite accurate, since changes

> may be made in a backwards-compatible way.

>

> Bug: 1432981

> Change-Id: If72a2f1ed94a7d6d08a832123929aeeaef042541

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1163044}
